alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, southwestern Greensville and southeastern Brunswick Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms over Barley, or 8 miles north of Roanoke Rapids. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Roanoke Rapids around 330 PM EDT. Gaston around 335 PM EDT. Dahlia around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ante, Brink, Pleasant Hill, Gum Forks, Triplet, Roanoke Rapids Lake, Henrico, Turners Crossroads, Vultare and Slates Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
